DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of entecavir plus tenofovir combination therapy with that of entecavir monotherapy. Safety will also be studied.
DOC.brief_title: Entecavir Plus Tenofovir Combination Therapy Versus Entecavir Monotherapy in Naive Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis B
DOC.criteria: Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection (hepatitis B e antigen [HbeAg]positive or negative) disease Nucleoside and nucleotidenaive Males or females ≥16 years of age (or minimum age of consent in a given country) Compensated liver function HBV DNA >1.72*10*5*IU/mL (approximately 10*6*copies/mL) for HbeAgpositive participants HBV DNA >1.72*10*4*IU/mL (approximately 10*5*copies/mL) for HbeAgnegative participants Alanine aminotransferase level ≥*upper limit of normal (ULN) and ≤10*ULN Evidence of decompensated cirrhosis Coinfection with human immunodeficiency virus, hepatitis C virus, or hepatitis D virus Laboratory values out of protocolspecified range
